citation.article-title: Tepidanaerobacter syntrophicus gen. nov., sp. nov., an anaerobic, moderately thermophilic, syntrophic alcohol- and lactate-degrading bacterium isolated from thermophilic digested sludges.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Tepidanaerobacter (Te.pi.da.nae.ro.bac′ter. L. adj. tepidus moderately warm; Gr. pref. an not; Gr. n. aer air; N.L. masc. n. bacter rod; N.L. masc. n. Tepidanaerobacter moderately thermophilic anaerobic rod).
Cells are non-motile, rod- or filament-shaped.
Cells grow under strictly anaerobic conditions.
Neither photosynthetic nor aerobic growth is observed.
The main fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, C16 : 0 and C15 : 1.
Phylogenetic position is in a deeply branched lineage of the phylum Firmicutes.
The type species is Tepidanaerobacter syntrophicus.
